Designer/Developer

Mike Lacourse

My clients love me because I'm easy to work with and I do great work. I’m able to keep costs down by running a small shop and by working with technology that's affordable & open-source. From your brand to your next great idea, you can trust it will be developed thoughtfully and practically.

Featured Work

Double Toasted

http://doubletoasted.com/community/

The new home of the late great Spill.com community. At it’s height, the site saw 5 million visitors a month and over a half a million users. The new site employs a freemium model and an on-demand / subscription system for users to buy access to hilarious and biting movie and pop culture commentary. I designed and built the back and front end for this social network and on-demand service using WordPress, Buddypress, & WooCommerce as the backbone.

Naked Capitalism

http://www.nakedcaptialism.com

The world’s most influential finance and economics blog with trenchant commentary, penetrating investigation, and insider political/regulatory analysis. I re-designed and re-coded the entire front-end to look great on any screen, big or small.

Spark Fitness

http://sparkfitnessaustin.com/class-schedule/

Spark Fitness Club is Austin's newest full service gym located in the always electrifying downtown. This responsive calendar required a unique approach to pulling daily data from the backend. The end result matched the design comp pixel-perfect and translated seamlessly to mobile. I also built a back-end interface for managing classes and trainers in WordPress.

Verdtek

http://www.verdtek.com

A tech startup based in Austin who does great work with young people in the community (see generation tek). I built the front and back end of the site based on design comps from the marketing consultant.

Prickly Pair Farms

http://pricklypairfarm.com/

I designed and built the back and front end of this Austin startup’s site with a couple of cool custom features like a flower inventory system and instagram feed.

Introducing

Mike Lacourse

I'm equal parts visual designer, back-end developer, front-end developer, and branding advocate. I work especially well with small business’s and entrepeneurs who are looking for help with the technical side of their business. I also offer branding & logo services in collaboration with Pound Design.

Well built web.

You'll get a beautiful, fast, reliable web site coded and tested to work on mobile, tablet, and desktop resolutions as well as all the major browsers and operating systems. For most projects, I ask for half up front to begin work and half once the project is approved and uploaded to your server.

Built on WordPress

WordPress powers a staggering 23% of the internet and has grown into a mature and flexible framework that can power even a complex web business. Most WordPress extensions are affordable if not open-source and can sometimes cut the development costs on big projects up to 50-75%. Building on top of existing infastructure allows me to spend my time getting the details right, creating a satisfying, effective user experience.

No other platform embodies the spirit of democratic, open source software more than WordPress. The platform was built by the people, for the people, and in the process catalyzed the largest do-it-yourself community in the world. That means if you ever have a question about WordPress, it's probably been asked and answered a hundred times over.
